statistics.claim: Traditional urban design recommends 1:1 to 1:3 building height to street width ratio for human-scaled enclosure
statistics.source: Allan Jacobs, Great Streets (1993) - classical reference, needs contemporary verification

studies.title: Great Streets
studies.finding: Analyzed 300+ streets worldwide; identified optimal proportions for pedestrian comfort including height-to-width ratios

studies.title: Cities for People
studies.finding: Established principles for human-scale urban design including visual field and building proportions

examples.description: Consistent building heights (approximately 6-7 stories) with chamfered corners creating defined street enclosure
examples.source: Well-documented historic example - specific outcomes require verification

examples.description: Regulated building heights relative to street width (historically ~20m height for wider boulevards)
examples.source: Historic urban planning - specific current regulations require verification

notes: IMPORTANT: I was unable to access web search or fetch tools to verify current sources.
